subject: Protection
author: Aquarius
full_text:
Hi, all.

I'm a happy lurker here, I read everything since I signed on a few months
ago. I haven't yet had time to try using the hack setup, my life has been,
shall we say, very intensive and busy of late.

I have been involved with psychic work for most of my life, and have
channeled one specific guide since 1971, so contact with "the other side" is
a part of my normal, everyday life. I don't do this professionally, I am a
corporate/business consultant, and do some TV stuff in that domain, but
haven't been in the public eye for psychic-related things since the mid-1970's.

To me, there has never been any doubt in my mind whatsoever that we live on
beyond our physical bodies, it's been proven to me countless times in my own
experience. The value of the boxes and hacks are to capture the actual
voices as a record, which I think is VERY cool... but to me, it's not about
proving the existence of the non-visible world; to me that's a given. 

My Mom passed away after a long illness this past January, and though I miss
her terribly (I was her main caregiver for years) and am sorry she is not
here, incarnate any longer, I know she was joyful to leave her badly ailing
body, and to move on to a happier new life. I happened to be at a meeting
with a really good medium a couple of weeks later, and my Mom came through
right away, insistently (just like her in mortal life! <g>), and was just
hilarious. She mentioned a couple of very specific details that only I would
know, and I got great comfort that she came through someone else so I knew
it wasn't my own wishful thinking that she'd stay in a little contact.

She has since moved on for now, I know she needs that and she is joyful to
be in her new experience, so I am content not to bother her for now... but
it would have been way cool to have had those messages, so clearly from her,
in her own voice and not the voice of the medium. That's why I think all the
research here is so important and vital, so please keep it up! <g>

Here's my take on the issue of protection when contacting discarnate beings:

Beings on the other side aren't much different from we folks who currently
reside in physical bodies. We all, carnate and discarnate, have our
personalities and quirks, some of us are more evolved, kinder beings, and
some of us just aren't so nice, or are caught in our narrowly focused
material-world oriented egos. Simply put: there are as many good and mean
entities on the other side as there are people in our five-senses world, not
much difference.

We all need to use our simple common sense in this world and the other; if
someone is treating you with respect, kindly, or at least dispassionately,
why not keep the contact going? If they are trashing you, trying to scare
you, manipulate you, etc... why bother continuing with them? If you got a
crank call on your telephone, I'd hope you'd just hang up! 

Same with entities... I expect them to treat me well, and I will treat them
well. If they get out of line, I'm outta there, I'm not going to put up with
any nonsense just because they happen not to be in a physical body at the time.

I don't believe any entity can harm me in any way; it is only my own fear or
thrill of being in contact with the dark forces that can harm me, if I go
there. Just as with other people, any harm done depends very much on how I
react to them in addition to how they are treating me.

So: I recommend having very good boundaries and not letting the fact that
you are in contact with discarnate beings sway you into thinking you need to
be any more deferential or afraid than you would be with a person standing
right in front of you. Remember the golden rule, do unto others as you would
have others do unto you, and don't go there with the crank calls... just
tell them you're not interested, and not to contact you again because you
will break the contact if they keep misbehaving. If they keep it up, you
know where the "off" button is... use it!

As an aside, I also don't think we're here to provide interdimensional
psychotherapy to troubled spirits; of course offer help and comfort if you
can if they ask for it or need it, but don't get hooked. <ggg>

Ok, I'll get off my soapbox now, sorry if I was long-winded, but I wanted to
contribute some support and comfort to those here who are so busily doing
such great research.

Many thanks,

Leslie
